documents.document: @MrsReynoldsRBE I think plants make such a difference to air quality and calm environment!

@edutinker No extra sources of funding. Found many pieces in yard sales, thrift stores, cast aways from family, friends, neighbours. Plants have been propogated and divided numerous times. My financial investment is in books.
@MrsReynoldsRBE Thanks Emily - yes very conscious of a calm environment with lots of nature and environment as 3rd teacher
Excited to build a new classroom community with incoming 2s and 3s! #vsb39 https://t.co/ezFNP6YIws

@LoraSarchet So calm and lovely! I spy some fantastic new picture books on display! Love the jug with the sticks and branches. How did you attach your frames to the wall? Have a great first week and a beautiful year.

@literacybigkids I have only ever been a classroom teacher where I teach everything. Honestly best situation I ever had was where I looped a Grade 2/3 into a 2/3/4 into a 3/4. Taught many children for two or even three years. Relationships = where magic happens!
@literacybigkids So wonderful! What an experience for both of you.

Working on my #pb10for10 list and getting emotional. So excited about this list . . . One more day until an incredible exchange of picture book love happens! Thank you @CathyMere and @mandyrobek for bringing this even into the world!

@holtzymook I haven't stopped laughing
This was beyond fun! And just the right level of challenge. Peers helped us check that we had met criteria before we built. @renomyclass https://t.co/PyFkTdd15r
"Ms Gelson, we noticed you like plants so we brought you this." 😄 I have never been gifted with a chunk of grass before! https://t.co/KVhbj2hIzh
"Shouldn't the library be called the bookery?" asked a brilliant little reader #kidsarereading and asking great questions!
@alizateach So true! We need to trust that when they are reading (no matter what format or level) great things are happening. I am all about student choice!

@alizateach I had a student last year (Grade 3) who read graphics 90% or more of the time. She was not reading at grade level at the start of the year and by end of year was fully meeting - grew 2 grade levels! Thank you graphics and time to read!

@alizateach @Kateywrites @Kpteach5 @oonziela @ChristinaNosek @MissNikkiIn5th @cupcake_savant @GraphixBooks @donalynbooks @TerryTreads @EdWeekTeacher @Scholastic @BU_Tweets Thanks for sharing all of these!
Fantastic reading happening here! https://t.co/Vc1u6vkioE
RT @OpalSchool: Our classroom environments aren't designed with Pinterest in mind: they reflect our values and advance our intentions. http…

@MarkChubb3 @MrsAWilder But at same time, this allowed other students who typically struggle and need more support to shine and I can't even think about it without a huge smile thinking of the 2 girls who kept asking. "WE did it??" Yes!

@MarkChubb3 @MrsAWilder Yes! My math students who often grasp things quickly, were not able to solve these (YET!!) and we had a great conversation about the gift of a task that lets them struggle. As they left yesterday, "I want to try again tomorrow."

@MrsAWilder @MarkChubb3 Some worked for 50 minutes and didn't solve them! And still engaged! 2 children who were first to solve were shocked because math often a challenge. Such a wonderful afternoon of learning

@MrsAWilder @MarkChubb3 For my students (my last year's 3s starting 4) I gave them hint to make each skyscraper level same colour so all 1s blue, 2s orange, 3s pink, 4s red for example. Makes it easier to be organized
@MrsAWilder It is a towers/skyscraper game https://t.co/sN43p73uSY from @MarkChubb3 Students LOVED
